docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration estimates that up to 29 percent of U.S. taxpayers could have to take the law known as Obamacare into account as they complete their 2014 income tax returns, officials said on Wednesday.

headline.main: U.S. Government Says Obamacare Could Affect Up to 29 Percent of Taxpayers
headline.print_headline: U.S. Government Says Obamacare Could Affect Up to 29 Percent of Taxpayers

docs.snippet: The Obama administration estimates that up to 29 percent of U.S. taxpayers could have to take the law known as Obamacare into account as they complete their 2014 income tax returns, officials said on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Insurance companies, perhaps more than previously thought, may be charging the sickest patients extra for drugs under the federal health law, in an effort to discourage them from choosing certain plans, according to a study released Wednesday.

headline.main: Study: Insurers May Using Drug Costs to Discriminate
headline.print_headline: Study: Insurers May Using Drug Costs to Discriminate

docs.snippet: Insurance companies, perhaps more than previously thought, may be charging the sickest patients extra for drugs under the federal health law, in an effort to discourage them from choosing certain plans, according to a study released Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A former airline pilot who reached the heights of the music promotion business by producing shows for acts ranging from the Rolling Stones to Santana to Coldplay sat shackled in a Florida courtroom Wednesday, faced with a $300 million fraud case after spending years fighting extradition from Brazil.

headline.main: Back From Brazil, Ex-Music Promoter Faces $300M Fraud Case
headline.print_headline: Back From Brazil, Ex-Music Promoter Faces $300M Fraud Case

docs.snippet: A former airline pilot who reached the heights of the music promotion business by producing shows for acts ranging from the Rolling Stones to Santana to Coldplay sat shackled in a Florida courtroom Wednesday, faced with a $300 million fraud case...

docs.abstract: For women living in poverty, the cost of feminine hygiene products is yet another burden on an already stretched budget.
docs.snippet: For women living in poverty, the cost of feminine hygiene products is yet another burden on an already stretched budget.

docs.lead_paragraph: Anthem has hiked its quarterly cash payout to shareholders by nearly 43 percent to keep up with its rising stock price after edging past Wall Street forecasts for the recently completed fourth quarter.

headline.main: Anthem Raises Dividend Almost 43 Pct, Tops 4Q Forecasts
headline.print_headline: Anthem Raises Dividend Almost 43 Pct, Tops 4Q Forecasts

docs.snippet: Anthem has hiked its quarterly cash payout to shareholders by nearly 43 percent to keep up with its rising stock price after edging past Wall Street forecasts for the recently completed fourth quarter.

docs.lead_paragraph: Most Americans including significant numbers of Republicans would want lawmakers to restore federal aid for buying coverage under President Barack Obama's health care law if the Supreme Court annuls some of the subsidies, according to a poll released Wednesday.

headline.main: Poll: Most Say Restore Health Aid if Court Kills Subsidies
headline.print_headline: Poll: Most Say Restore Health Aid if Court Kills Subsidies

docs.snippet: Most Americans including significant numbers of Republicans would want lawmakers to restore federal aid for buying coverage under President Barack Obama's health care law if the Supreme Court annuls some of the subsidies, according to a poll released...

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans in Congress are trying to dismantle the Affordable Care Act piece by piece.
docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes Congressional Republicans for their continuing attempts to weaken Affordable Care Act, most recent of which is bill that would encourage many employers to cease offering coverage to their employees; notes that measure, called Save American Workers Act, has some bipartisan support, making it a threat; warns that Pres Obama may not be able to veto bill if it is attached to other important legislation.
docs.snippet: Republicans in Congress are trying to dismantle the Affordable Care Act piece by piece.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The new coalition said it is committed to finding a way to change financial incentives, moving the bulk of payments to so-called “value-based” arrangements by 2020.

headline.main: Industry Group to Back Results-Focused Care
headline.print_headline: Industry Group to Back Results-Focused Care

docs.abstract: Coalition of some of America's largest health care systems and insurers pledges to fundamentally alter how hospitals and doctors are paid; shift would place far less emphasis on quantity of delivered care, focusing instead on improving quality and lowering costs; plans are in line with changes signaled by Health and Human Services Secretary Sylvia M Burwell.
docs.snippet: The new coalition said it is committed to finding a way to change financial incentives, moving the bulk of payments to so-called “value-based” arrangements by 2020.

docs.lead_paragraph: After a lengthy back-and-forth, the Obama administration has agreed to let Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana, a Republican, expand Medicaid on his own terms, including some that have not been allowed before under federal rules.

headline.main: Indiana Will Allow Entry to Medicaid for a Price
headline.print_headline: Indiana Will Allow Entry to Medicaid for a Price

docs.abstract: Obama administration, in unprecedented move, agrees to allow Indiana Gov Mike Pence to expand Medicaid in state to include mandate of monthly premiums for those above poverty level of 2 percent of their household incomes; additional 350,000 residents will be covered under plan, which also features penalties for non-payment.
docs.snippet: After a lengthy back-and-forth, the Obama administration has agreed to let Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana, a Republican, expand Medicaid on his own terms, including some that have not been allowed before under federal rules.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: As a Feb. 15 deadline approaches, the Obama administration said 9.5 million people had signed up for insurance this year through public marketplaces set up under the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Health Care Enrollment Appears to Be Near Goal
headline.print_headline: Health Care Enrollment Appears to Be Near Goal

docs.abstract: Obama administration reports 9.5 million people have signed up for health care coverage through public marketplaces in 2015; White House expects a surge of enrollments just before Affordable Care Act enrollment deadline on Feb 15.
docs.snippet: As a Feb. 15 deadline approaches, the Obama administration said 9.5 million people had signed up for insurance this year through public marketplaces set up under the Affordable Care Act.
